Junior Technical Account Manager APAC

Company Name Intelligent Reach Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Company Overview:


Are you excited about new technology and online retail? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team working with the leading retail brands worldwide? Do you want a voice and the ability to shape your future and the future of retailers?

\xa0

Yes… then read on.

\xa0

Intelligent Reach is a retail technology platform connecting online retailers with their consumers wherever they are in the world. \xa0Used currently by over 160 global retail brands including some of the most renowned names in the market, across 22 countries. Having recently secured a multi-million pound investment we are looking to recruit exceptional people to help us grow the company and lead the industry. \xa0

\xa0

The Intelligent Reach platform provides online retailers with true marketing agility to position their products across over 600 online marketing channels. Our platform then optimises all activity to ensure profitability for our retailers...and that is just scratching the surface of the power of the platform. We support our customers with world-class managed services to drive the success of their online marketing.

\xa0

Position Overview:


We are looking for a Junior and experience Technical Account Manager. As a Technical Account Manager you will be responsible for the data acquisition of Intelligent Reach merchants across all markets using in house tools and 3rd party applications. Your role will include on-boarding new merchants, proactive management of merchant’s data and digital performance, assessment of technical support issues, management of issue resolution and prioritisation of central resources to resolve matters in an efficient manner for our APAC customers.


\xa0

Key Skills:


Good communication skills, highly organised, analytical, sharp, confident, advanced excel, good computer skills and an understanding of online marketing channels and terminology.

\xa0

What do we require from you?


We are looking for someone who is self-motivated and has a good understanding of cur-rent web technology.


Must have:


  • Super Organised and driven to deliver excellent customer service
  • Understanding of product data quality and its impact on digital marketing.
  • Use our platform to carry out certain data quality improvements.
  • Super organised and able to manage client's expectations.
  • Be able to quickly understand complex technology solutions
  • Ability to work on own initiative with light management
  • Liaise with existing clients on existing activity, promotional campaigns, advise on new partners or channels.

Nice to have:


  • 2 years experience of dealing with customers in a technical environment, ideally with data feeds.
  • Online marketing experience
  • AdWords certifications
  • eBay experience
  • Experience of managing Data driven performance optimisation for multi-channel online client Campaigns.
  • Bachelor’s degree (ideally math or science) with a minimum of 1 year work experi-ence a strong plus preferably in the e-commerce industry.

The Appointment
Due to growth across the business they are looking for an Estimator to join their team. \xa0This role will see you working specifically across glazing, aluminium and cladding for commercial construction projects. 829651995:
[

Senior Specialist - Leadership Development

Company Name Newcrest Mining Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 274 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you passionate about Management and Leadership training and development?


Are you looking for a transformational role with global and domestic travel? Keen to facilitate leadership development and practical management training that contributes to a company-wide learning culture? If so, read on to find out more.


Overview
We are seeking a Senior Specialist, Leadership Development to join our Melbourne based team. Reporting to the Manager of Leadership Development, you will contribute to the ongoing transformation of Newcrest by designing, delivering, and helping to manage our new, company-wide Leadership and Management Capability Development program ManagingMatters, aimed at 1,400 people leaders across 5 operating sites and corporate office.


Your responsibilities will include:


  • Facilitating face-to-face workshops and virtual classroom modules;
  • Designing innovative, blended learning experiences, e.g. podcasts, virtual classrooms, eLearning ‘just in time’ resources to help our leaders live our values and advance our practices.
  • End-to-end program management of ManagingMatters
  • Designing an effective measurement approach to establish baseline and impact of leadership and management development activities.
  • Significant domestic and global travel, approximately 1-2 weeks per month.

About You
Our ideal candidate will have approximately 10 years’ experience in training, learning and development, with at least 3 years in the areas of Leadership & Management. In addition to solid facilitation skills, you will be able to deliver classroom training 4-5 days a week and demonstrate a strong proficiency in virtual delivery, including set-up, facilitation and close out modules using virtual platforms (e.g. Success Factors, WebEx).


You will have experience of working effectively in a multicultural and international environment and its attendant travel. Your confidence, professionalism and executive presence in front of senior management audiences will equip you to comfortably communicate with both site leadership teams and front-line employees.


Possessing excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills, you will be self-driven with the ability to prioritise effectively in a fast-paced, demanding and delivery focused environment. Experience in a similar heavy industry would be advantageous.


About Us
Newcrest is the largest gold producer listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and one of the world’s largest gold mining companies.


Our people work together across locations in Australia, Papua New Guinea, Fiji and Indonesia and in every location, our people live our values and share our vision of being the Miner of Choice™. We’re committed to supporting a safe, diverse and inclusive culture where our talents and differences are valued. If you’re looking for a rewarding career that offers world-class opportunities, talk with us.


It’s an exciting time to be a part of Newcrest.


Please note we may consider applications on an ongoing basis and therefore encourage you to apply at your earliest opportunity.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Mining & Metals

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Human Resources

Job description

Educator - Eltham

Goodstart is Australia’s largest early learning provider. As a not–for–profit social enterprise, we exist purely to improve the lives of Australia’s children and their families. Our people are our foundation, together we are working to ensure children have the learning, development and wellbeing outcomes they need for school and life.

We’re looking for an inspiring and enthusiastic educator to join a highly motivated team, providing fun and educational programs to children in our care.

As a passionate childcare professional you will be committed to providing the highest quality of care and will be rewarded with the opportunity to build your career within a supportive and rewarding environment.

Our centre
  • Welcoming and fun environment
  • Over 90% occupancy
  • Exceeding National Quality Standards
  • Based in Eltham

Your role
  • Certificate III level early childhood qualification (ACECQA approved)
  • Hold a current First Aid qualification
  • Permanent Part Time
  • 24 hours per week on a rotating roster (full flexibility preferred)
  • Based in the Nursery


Responsibilities
  • Actively contribute to the education program in the room and the centre team
  • Engage and supervise the children at all times
  • Maintain a safe environment for children, families and team members
  • Build and maintain strong, positive relationships with children and families
  • Comply with National Quality Standards and Goodstart policies and procedures
  • Support a culture of reflective practice and ongoing continuous improvement


The Benefits
  • Competitive above award wages
  • Supportive and friendly team
  • Ability to cash in annual leave
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • Comprehensive induction and training programme
  • Discounted childcare fees
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Career pathways
  • Uniform allowance

If you have a passion for working with children, then this is the role for you!

Goodstart is committed to child safety, with a zero tolerance of child abuse, and expect all our employees to reflect this commitment. Should you strive to uphold and reflect these values then we would love to hear from you!

To apply, please click “Apply Now” to complete the Goodstart Inspiring Careers process. #gseducator

Job description

Description

About Hall & Wilcox

Hall & Wilcox is a pre-eminent independent business law firm with one of the fastest growing partnerships in Australia. We are currently a firm of more than 550 people, including 70 partners. We have offices in Melbourne, Sydney, Newcastle, Canberra, Perth and Brisbane and act nationally for Australian-based clients and multinational clients with Australian interests. Our leadership team was recognised by winning Managing Partner of the Year at the 2015 and 2017 Australian Law Awards.

About The Role And The Team

We have an exciting opportunity for a Mailroom Co-ordinator to join our Melbourne office. Reporting directly to the Melbourne Office Manager, this role will be responsible for supervising the activities of eight Service Clerks to ensure the Mailroom is running smoothly and efficiently.

Duties
  • Supervise Service Clerks
  • Coordinate workflow and delegate mailroom tasks
  • Develop weekly mailroom roster
  • Assist with general mailroom duties
  • Implement new processes and procedures
  • Ensure tasks deadlines are met and reviewing tasks as they are completed
  • Handle enquiries from internal clients
  • Liaise with suppliers and order office supplies
  • Deliver training


Skills And Experience
  • Experience working in a mailroom within professional services
  • Experience supervising a team
  • Strong attention to detail and organisational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Client service focus
  • Team player

Culture

At Hall & Wilcox, we practise Smarter Law. This means being smarter across our entire business – by being progressive, by our commitment to excellence and by our focus on building great relationships.

We have a strong values-driven culture - our clients and people choose to work with us because of it. We care about our clients, our community and each other. Whether it be our technology or our business focused approach to the practise of law, we strive to change the legal market for the better. We work hard but we also have fun.

Benefits
  • Modern, open plan offices
  • Structured learning & development programs for all career levels
  • Extensive health & wellbeing program including healthy start breakfast program, mindfulness training subsidised fitness, team sports and health checks
  • Flexible working opportunities – talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you
  • Salary continuance insurance


How To Apply

To apply for this position please click the apply button above. For more information please contact Lauren Parrant, People & Culture Advisor on 03 9603 3669.

Recruiters Please Note

Applications from Recruitment Agencies not briefed will not be accepted for this advertised position. For further information about Hall & Wilcox please visit our website.

Job Description

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology.

We are looking for a technical Software Architect to provide application architecture leadership and deliverables for selected DXC Health product(s). Areas of focus will include application architecture, performance engineering, software quality, delivery methodologies and best practices.

You will make informed decisions and provide architecture analysis, design, socialisation and governance for software development.

You will have the ability to engage with stakeholders at various levels within the organisation, and with selected customers to develop application architecture, technology decisions, and influence methodology and practices for software design.

In addition, you will assist in the provision of architecture and technical deliverables to aid the professional services and support department activities in the effective implementation and ongoing effective support of the portfolio applications.

The ideal candidate for this role will have a strong technical background and excellent IT skills. In addition, they will have good communication and collaboration skills, with experience working with onshore and offshore teams.

Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with other professionals to determine functional and non-functional requirements for software or applications
  • Use tools and methodologies to create representations for functions and user interface of desired product
  • Develop high-level product specifications with attention to system integration and feasibility  Define all aspects of development from appropriate technology and workflow to coding standards
  • Communicate successfully all concepts and guidelines to development team
  • Oversee progress of development team to ensure consistency with initial design
  • Provide technical guidance and coaching to developers and engineers
  • Ensure software meets all requirements of quality, security, modifiability, extensibility etc.

Experience
  • Experience as a software architect
    Experience in software development and coding in various languages (C#, .NET, Java etc.)
  • Excellent knowledge of software and application design and architecture
  • Excellent knowledge of UML and other modelling methods
  • Understanding of software performance tuning and optimisation
  • Understanding of software quality best practices
  • Understanding of agile delivery methodologies
  • Familiarity with HTML/CSS, JavaScript and UI/UX design
  • A technical mindset with great attention to detail
  • High quality organizational and leadership skills
  • Outstanding communication and presentation abilities
  • MSc/MA in computer science, engineering or relevant field

Trust, Transform & Thrive with a company whose mission is to leading clients on their digital transformation journeys, DXC Technology will be recognized globally as a force multiplier, enabling clients to seize the opportunities presented by today’s rapidly changing technologies
